name: Virginia Woolf
bio: English writer, considered one of the most important modernist 20th-century authors and a pioneer in the use of stream of consciousness as a narrative device.

name: James Joyce
bio: Irish novelist, short story writer, and poet, considered one of the most influential writers of the 20th century.

name: F. Scott Fitzgerald
bio: American novelist, essayist, and short story writer, best known for his novel 'The Great Gatsby'.

name: Ernest Hemingway
bio: American novelist, short story writer, and journalist, known for his economical and understated style.

name: T.S. Eliot
bio: Poet, essayist, publisher, playwright, and literary critic, considered one of the 20th century's major poets.

name: Marcel Proust
bio: French novelist, critic, and essayist best known for his monumental novel 'In Search of Lost Time'.

name: Franz Kafka
bio: German-speaking Bohemian novelist and short-story writer, widely regarded as one of the major figures of 20th-century literature.

name: George Orwell
bio: English novelist, essayist, journalist, and critic, best known for 'Animal Farm' and '1984'.

name: Aldous Huxley
bio: English writer and philosopher, best known for his novel 'Brave New World'.

name: William Faulkner
bio: American writer known for his novels and short stories set in the fictional Yoknapatawpha County.
